intro: Hieracium lanuiceps, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its tall, upright growth habit and yellow flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are usually hairy as well. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Hieracium lanuiceps is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
